title: Coin pouch

properties.name: description
properties.value: A coin pouch is an item obtained from pickpocketing certain NPCs, which contains a number of coins depending on the NPC it was obtained from. To obtain the coins from them, players can simply click their stack of coin pouches to open them all at once, or they can right-click them to open one at a time. Up to 28 coin pouches can stack in a player's inventory, after which the player must open them to collect the coins inside before being able to pickpocket more. They cannot be traded or banked.

SMW Subobject for WatchmanExamine: A pouch full of coins taken from the pockets of a watchman.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Coin pouchUses infobox: ItemImage: File:Coin pouch (watchman).pngWeight: 0.000Value: 1Version anchor: WatchmanRelease date: 12 July 2018Item ID: 22533

A coin pouch is an item obtained from pickpocketing certain NPCs, which contains a number of coins depending on the NPC it was obtained from. To obtain the coins from them, players can simply click their stack of coin pouches to open them all at once, or they can right-click them to open one at a time. Up to 28 coin pouches can stack in a player's inventory, after which the player must open them to collect the coins inside before being able to pickpocket more. They cannot be traded or banked.

Coin pouches are obtained every pickpocket from Men, Women, Farmers, Warriors, Warrior women, Guards, Fremenniks, Knights of Ardougne, and Paladins. They can also be obtained occasionally from HAM members, Rogues, Cave goblins, Kharidian Bandits, Watchmen, Gnomes, Heroes, and Elves. Each NPC gives a separate coin pouch; for example, a coin pouch from pickpocketing guards does not stack with pouches from pickpocketing Ardougne knights. NPCs who are pickpocketed via blackjacking yield coins directly while they are knocked out instead of coin pouches. If rogue equipment is used to receive double the loot from pickpocketing, only one coin pouch is obtained (containing the normal amount) while the other half is obtained directly as coins.

Coin pouch quantities[edit | edit source]

NPC Level Amount
Man/Woman 1 3
Farmer 10 9
Female H.A.M. member 15 1-21
Male H.A.M. member 20 1-21
Warrior woman/
Al-Kharid warrior		 25 18
Rogue 32 25-40
Cave goblin 36 10-50
Guard 40 30
Fremennik 45 40
Bearded Pollnivnian Bandit 45 40
Desert Bandit 53 30
Knight of Ardougne 55 50
Pollnivian Bandit 55 50
Watchman 65 60
Menaphite Thug 65 60
Paladin 70 80
Gnome 75 300
Hero 80 200-300
Vyre 82 250315
Elf 85 280350

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Previously, pickpocketing NPCs would directly yield coins instead of coin pouches. The coin pouch was added as a method to combat autoclicking while keeping experience rates as similar as possible.
  • Minutes after release, the game servers were turned off due to an issue caused by coin pouches where on death, any stackable items were turned into a maximum stack of coins (2,147,483,647). The game was rolled back to the time of the update, and after approximately six hours, the servers were online again.[1]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Mod Sween. "Old School RuneScape Status Update". 12 July 2018. (Archived from the original.) Old School RuneScape News.

[[pickpocketing]] certain [[NPC]]s, which contains a number of [[coins]] depending on the NPC it was obtained from. To obtain the coins from them, players can simply click their stack of coin pouches to open them all at once, or they can right-click them to open one at a time. Up to 28 coin pouches can stack in a player's inventory, after which the player must open them to collect the coins inside before being able to pickpocket more. They cannot be traded or banked. Coin pouches are obtained every pickpocket from [[Man|Men]], [[Woman|Women]], [[Farmer]]s, [[Warrior]]s, [[Warrior woman|Warrior women]], [[Guard]]s, [[Fremennik]]s, [[Knights of Ardougne]], and [[Paladin]]s. They can also be obtained occasionally from [[H.A.M. Member|HAM members]], [[Rogue]]s, [[Cave goblin (Dorgesh-Kaan)|Cave goblins]], [[Bandit (Bandit Camp)|Kharidian Bandits]], [[Watchman|Watchmen]], [[Gnome]]s, [[Hero]]es, and [[Elf|Elves]]. Each NPC gives a separate coin pouch; for example, a coin pouch from pickpocketing guards does not stack with pouches from pickpocketing Ardougne knights. NPCs who are pickpocketed via [[Thieving training#Levels 45-55/91: Blackjacking|blackjacking]] yield coins directly while they are knocked out instead of coin pouches.
